Class Moving

  • java.lang.Object
    • Renderable
      • ImageBox
        • OnGrid
          • Entity
            • Moving
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Enemy, Player

    public class Moving
extends Entity
    An entity that can move.
    Version:
    1.2
    Author:
    Josiah Richards

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Moving(int x, int y, Map map)
      Creating a Moving Entity at a given coordinate for a map.
      Moving(int x, int y, Map map, Direction startingDirection)
      Creating a Moving Entity at a given coordinate and facing a given direction for a map.
      Moving(Map map)
      Creating a Moving Entity at 0,0 for a map.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canMove(Direction direction)
      Checks if this is allowed to move in a direction.
      boolean canWalkOn(OnGrid gridObject)
      Checks if this is allowed to walk on an object on the grid.
      boolean canWalkOn(Vector2 point)
      Checks if this can walk on a given coordinate.
      void move(Direction direction)
      Moves in a direction if its able to, triggering anything this steps on in the process.
      void turnLeft()
      Turns this entity left(doesn't actually move)
      void turnRight()
      Turns this entity right(doesn't actually move)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Moving

        public Moving(int x,
              int y,
              Map map,
              Direction startingDirection)
        Creating a Moving Entity at a given coordinate and facing a given direction for a map. Doesn't create add itself to the map!
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of this Moving Entity on the map.
        y - The y coordinate of this Moving Entity on the map.
        map - The map this is for.
        startingDirection - The direction this starts facing.

      • Moving

        public Moving(int x,
              int y,
              Map map)
        Creating a Moving Entity at a given coordinate for a map. Doesn't create add itself to the map! Starts facing right by default.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of this Moving Entity on the map.
        y - The y coordinate of this Moving Entity on the map.
        map - The map this is for.

      • Moving

        public Moving(Map map)
        Creating a Moving Entity at 0,0 for a map. Doesn't create add itself to the map! Starts facing right by default.
        Parameters:
        map - The map this is for.

    • Method Detail

      • canWalkOn

        public boolean canWalkOn(OnGrid gridObject)
        Checks if this is allowed to walk on an object on the grid.
        Parameters:
        gridObject - The OnGrid object in question.
        Returns:
        If this is allowed to walk on an object on the grid.

      • canWalkOn

        public boolean canWalkOn(Vector2 point)
        Checks if this can walk on a given coordinate. That is if it can walk on the cell and all the entities at that coordinate.
        Parameters:
        point - the point to check if it can be walked on
        Returns:
        True if this is allowed to walk on the coordinate, false otherwise.

      • canMove

        public boolean canMove(Direction direction)
        Checks if this is allowed to move in a direction.
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction this wants to move.
        Returns:
        If this is allowed to move in a direction.

      • turnLeft

        public void turnLeft()
        Turns this entity left(doesn't actually move)

      • turnRight

        public void turnRight()
        Turns this entity right(doesn't actually move)

      • move

        public void move(Direction direction)
        Moves in a direction if its able to, triggering anything this steps on in the process.
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction to move.
